Client

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • Client.Client

  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Client is the class for RMI client. The user will be able to input commands in the console.
    Valid commands are: help, add, time, lecture, quit.

    'help' shows the list of available commands.
    'add' allows the client to input lectures.
    'time' shows the free time the student has on each day.
    'lecture' shows all the already input lectures.
    'quit' closes the socket, as well as the server.

    Version:
    27.05.2017
    Author:
    M Chi Nguyen, 1206243

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add()
         throws java.lang.Exception
        The method is called when the user inputs 'add'. User can then add new lectures with the format 'ID Title Weekday TimeStart(HH:mm)'.
        Weekday is non-case sensitive.
        TimeStart has to be between 8:00 and 17:00.
        If the input are all valid, lecture will be added and send to the server through IRemoteLecture.addLecture()
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • check

        public int check(java.time.LocalTime time,
                 Lecture lecture)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        The method is called to check if the input lecture is duplicated. If yes the user can choose to overwrite.
        Parameters:
        time - starting time of the lecture
        lecture - the lecture that was input
        Returns:
        an int of 0, 1 or 2.
        0 = Not Duplicated.
        1 = Duplicated and Not replaced.
        2 = Duplicated and Replaced.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • error

        public void error()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Sub-method of addLecture(), called when there's an error. It prints in the console an error message and then tries to repeat the addLecture() for the user to input again.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getLectures

        public void getLectures()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        The method is called when the user inputs 'lecture'. The method sends a request to the server, in return the server replies with all lectures that were previously input by the user (even from previous sessions).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getTime

        public void getTime()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        The method is called when the user inputs 'time'. The method sends a request to the server, in return the server replies with the free time on each day printed in the client's console.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        This method starts the client, enabling the user to input in the console. Depending which command user inputs, the method will call other methods.
        Commands are non-case sensitive.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Main method, used to start the client
        Parameters:
        args - String array of main method
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
